Today, Dan and Jordan discuss the beginning of Alex's trial in Connecticut, and what's going on in the Infowars studio while the case plays out.  In this installment, Alex gets petty about his books sales, Tucker gets petty about Alex's book sales, and Alex covers Tucker getting petty about Alex's book sales.

==Detailed Show Notes==

Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/9/15/episode-725-september-13-14-2022 Episode #725: September 13-14, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex's trial in Connecticut has begun, and [[Norm Pattis]] is a disgusting lawyer
*Frogs [https://web.archive.org/web/20020208201036/https://www.fastcompany.com/online/01/frog.html don't behave the way Alex thinks] [https://archive-srel.uga.edu/outreach/ecoviews/ecoview071223.htm in relation to boiling water]

*Even [https://www.publishersweekly.com/pw/nielsen/HardcoverNonfiction.html using the source that Tucker is using], Alex sold less books than Jennette McCurdy
*Alex misreports [https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4206070 a pre-print paper] about arguments against booster mandates for people under 40
*Alex relays [https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/documents/inaugural-address-3 a fake Eisenhower quote]
*Alex [https://yournews.com/2022/09/13/2413033/cdc-director-admits-agency-gave-false-information-on-covid-19-vaccine/ misreports a story] about the CDC's monitoring of vaccine side-effects
*Alex [https://www1.cbn.com/cbnnews/us/2022/september/pray-teen-athlete-survives-mysterious-6-foot-blood-clot-but-now-football-is-off-the-table misreports a story] about a high school athlete [https://www.fox19.com/2021/06/29/bill-preventing-vaccine-mandates-ohio-schools-hits-dewines-desk/ from Ohio] with blood clots
